title: 101 Tips on Staying Safe at Home with Dementia: Avoid Falls, Floods, Injuries, Accidents, Doorstep Crime and More…
description:
The First of FIVE books on Dementia Care at home



 Are you a Dementia Caregiver? Are you looking after an elderly relative in yours or their home? Do you know someone who is about to start on the career to becoming a Dementia Caregiver?Is so, you’ve come to the right place! 


A brief insight of this book:



‘101 Tips on Staying Safe at Home with Dementia: Avoid falls, floods, injuries, accidents, doorstep crime and more… (Dementia Care at Home Book 1)’ is the first in a series of five books on providing successful Dementia Care at home.

'101 Tips on Staying Safe at Home with Dementia' is packed full of practical information gleaned over a decade of hands-on experience and further enhanced by the latest innovative practices and academic research into living well at home with dementia.

This “dementia caregiving in the home” book contains not only steps that can be taken to make the home safe and secure but provides information on how to create a living environment that offers enablement rather than restriction.



Here’s a preview of what you’ll discover within the pages of this book:


 
   How to make the house as safe and secure as possible, both internally and externally. 
   How to create an environment within the home of the person with Dementia that offers the opportunity to build on ability rather than limitation. 
   Proven strategies to promote safer walking, and help prevent wandering off and becoming lost. 
   How to use assistive technology to live safely and well at home. 
   How to put adequate measures in place to ensure personal safety and help stop doorstep crime. 
   And much more…
author: Catherine Verner
